label: activates
description: convert (something, such as a provitamin) into a biologically active derivative

label: actuates
description: cause to act in a particular way; motivate

label: associates
description: combine or join with other parts

label: binds to
description: to combine with, form a bond with, or be taken up by a chemical or chemical structure
example: "An enzyme is structured in such a way as to be able to bind with its substrate"

label: causes
description: make happen

label: constrains
description: severely restrict the scope, extent, or activity of

label: controls
description: determine the behaviour or supervise the running of

label: degrades
description: break down or deteriorate chemically

label: destroys
description: end the existence of something by damaging or attacking it

label: directs
description: control the operations of; manage or govern

label: downregulates
description: lower the rate or level of (a process such as gene expression, or sensitivity to a physiologically active substance) by downregulation

label: enhances
description: intensify, increase, or further improve the quality

label: facilitates
description: make (an action or process) easy or easier

label: forces
description: make something happen

label: hinders
description: make it difficult for something to happen

label: inactivates
description: make inactive or inoperative

label: increases
description: become or make greater in size, amount, or degree

label: induces
description: bring about or give rise to
example: none of these measures induced a change of policy

label: inhibits
description: hinder, restrain, or prevent (an action or process)

label: initiates
description: cause (a process or action) to begin
example: he proposes to initiate discussions on planning procedures

label: interrupts
description: stop the continuous progress of (an activity or process)

label: is
description: to show a permanent or temporary quality, state

label: limits
description: curtail or reduce in quantity or extent

label: mentions
description: refer to something

label: overproduces
description: produce an excessive amount
example: if soils are too fertile, the vines can overproduce, leading to vegetal aromas and flavors

label: phosphorylates
description: introduce a phosphate group into (a molecule or compound)

label: produces
description: cause (a particular result or situation) to happen or exist

label: provokes
description: call forth an action

label: reduces
description: diminish in size, amount, extent, or number

label: repress
description: inactivate (a gene or formation of a gene product)

label: reverts
description: return to previous state

label: secretes
description: (of a cell, gland, or organ) produce and discharge (a substance)
example: insulin is secreted in response to rising levels of glucose in the blood

label: shuts
description: cause to cease or suspend an operation or activity

label: stimulates
description: excite to activity or growth or to greater activity transactivate
example: induce an increased rate of gene expression triggered either by biological processes

label: suppress
description: inhibit the genetic expression of

label: triggers
description: initiate or set off

label: upregulates
description: increase the rate or level of (a process such as gene expression, or sensitivity to a physiologically active substance) by upregulation
